===Requirements===
* [[Adventure Rank]] 20 or above
* Complete [[Archon Quest]] [[Prologue]]: Act III "[[Song of the Dragon and Freedom]]"
* Complete Archon Quest [[Chapter IV]]: Act V "[[Masquerade of the Guilty]]" first to get the best experience from this event.

===Summary===
* During the event, stages in Assault Scenario and Defense Scenario will unlock in sequence after the event begins. Travelers must carefully consider the objectives, analyze enemy formations, and select units to deploy to complete challenges.
* During the event, stages in Assault Scenario and Defense Scenario will unlock in sequence after the event begins. Travelers must carefully consider the objectives, analyze enemy formations, and select units to deploy to complete challenges.
* During the challenge, after selecting a combat unit or a frontline building, it can be deployed within your base's staging area. After combat units have been deployed, they will automatically engage the enemy. Meanwhile, use your Leadership Skill at opportune moments to gain an edge for your party.
* Complete the event's various challenges to gain Analysis Progress. Reach a certain amount of Analysis Progress to obtain [[Cloudforged]] (Bow), [[Primogem]]s, [[Crown of Insight]], event-exclusive [[Weapon Refinement Material]]s, and other rewards.

===Tutorial===
;Overview
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 1.png
|text1  = After selecting a combat unit, it can be deployed within your base's staging area. When you are selecting combat units, you can jump to cancel your selection.<br>After combat units have been deployed, they will automatically engage the enemy.
|image2 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 2.png
|text2  = Leadership Skill usages will be replenished over time, and may have up to 2 usages at once.<br>Tap to use the Skill immediately or hold to aim the Skill. While aiming, Sprint or Jump to cancel using it.
|image3 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 3.png
|text3  = Different types of combat units suppress other types of units: AoE DMG units have a significant advantage against squad units.<br>At the same time, Melee units suppress Ranged units, Ranged units suppress Flying units, and Flying units suppress Melee units.
|image4 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 4.png
|text4  = Melee units are more resilient in battle, able to absorb more damage and protect other units to an extent.
}}
;Assault Scenarios
{{Tutorial
|image1 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 5.png
|text1  = During Assault Scenarios, your goal is to use combat units to destroy the opposing base
|image2 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 6.png
|text2  = In a short period of time after a Stronghold Mechanisms is destroyed, it will be reset as the opposing side's Stronghold Mechanism.<br>Units can be deployed near your own Stronghold Mechanisms.
|image3 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 7.png
|text3  = When there are only units from a single faction nearby, the Stronghold Flag will be captured by the faction after a certain period.<br>The faction controlling the Flag gains deployable units 25% faster. When you control the Flag, you can deploy units nearby.
}}
;Defense Scenarios
{{Tutorial
|image1  = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 8.png
|text1   = Defense Scenarios consist of 3 rounds. In each round, enemies will attack from different directions. You must protect your own Stronghold through the battle, taking as little damage as possible.
|image2  = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 9.png
|text2   = After combat units are defeated, they will drop Support Beacons.<br>Support Beacons can be used to deploy allied combat units and frontline buildings.
|image3 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 10.png
|text3  = During Defense Scenarios, after your combat units are no longer engaged in battle, they will return to the position they were originally deployed to. When deploying, take care to choose appropriately.
|image4 = Tutorial Mutual Security Enhancing Simulation 11.png
|text4  = During Defense Scenarios, when deploying combat units, their defensive zones will be visible. Once an opponent enters this zone, the unit will lock onto and initiate combat against them.
}}
